Package moulton.scalable.geometrics

Class Line

java.lang.Object
moulton.scalable.utils.MenuComponent
moulton.scalable.geometrics.Line
public class Line
extends MenuComponent
A simple line from two points on the (x,y) plane.
Author:
Matthew Moulton

      The string expressions to define the locations of the start and end points for the line segment.

    • y2

      protected java.lang.String y2
      The string expressions to define the locations of the start and end points for the line segment.

    • thickness

      protected java.lang.String thickness
      The thickness of the line to be drawn. If null or default, the line will be 1 pixel thick.
      See Also:
      setThickness(String), getThickness()

    • color

      protected java.awt.Color color
      The color of the line drawn.

  • Constructor Details

    • Line

      public Line​(Panel parent, java.lang.String x1, java.lang.String y1, java.lang.String x2, java.lang.String y2, java.awt.Color color)
      A simple line rendered from (x,y) to (x2,y2). The coordinates should be in the format specfied by MenuComponent.solveString(String, int, int)
      Parameters:
      parent - the panel that this text box will reside upon
      x1 - the starting x of the line
      y1 - the starting y of the line
      x2 - the ending x of the line. If x2 is '?', then it is a ditto of x
      y2 - the ending y of the line. If y2 is '?', then it is a ditto of y
      color - the color of the line

    • Line

      public Line​(Panel parent, int x, int y, java.lang.String x1, java.lang.String y1, java.lang.String x2, java.lang.String y2, java.awt.Color color)
      A simple line rendered from (x,y) to (x2,y2). The coordinates should be in the format specfied by MenuComponent.solveString(String, int, int)
      Parameters:
      parent - the panel that this text box will reside upon
      x - the integer x coordinate this line should appear on its panel
      y - the integer y coordinate this line should appear on its panel
      x1 - the starting x of the line
      y1 - the starting y of the line
      x2 - the ending x of the line. If x2 is '?', then it is a ditto of x
      y2 - the ending y of the line. If y2 is '?', then it is a ditto of y
      color - the color of the line

  • Method Details

    • render

      public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g, int xx, int yy, int ww, int hh)
      Description copied from class: MenuComponent
      Draws on the graphics object to represent this component visually. When this method is called, the type of panel storing (grid or free) has been taken into account and the dimensions of the space given to this component have been calculated using MenuComponent.solveString(String, int, int).
      Specified by:
      render in class MenuComponent
      Parameters:
      g - the graphics object to draw on
      xx - the x-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
      yy - the y-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
      ww - the width on the graphics image that this component is given
      hh - the height on the graphics image this component is given

    • getThickness

      public java.lang.String getThickness()
      Returns the thickness that this line will be drawn with. A null thickness will be 1 pixel thick.
      Returns:
      the draw thickness thickness

    • setThickness

      public void setThickness​(java.lang.String thickness)
      Sets the thickness of the line for drawing. A null thickness will be 1 pixel thick.
      Parameters:
      thickness - the thickness that this line will draw perpendicular to the slope of its line from start and end points
